repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: An intentionally assembled collection of newspapers, pamphlets, leaflets, broadsides, and miscellanea relating to anti-war, socialist, student, and radical political movements in the United States, Africa, Europe, Asia, and Latin America, 1946-1980.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of various donors. Accession 2001-M-051 gift of David Dellinger, 2000.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Movement (Protest) Collection. (MS 617). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An intentionally assembled collection of newspapers, pamphlets, leaflets, broadsides, and miscellanea relating to anti-war, socialist, student, and radical political movements in the United States, Africa, Europe, Asia, and Latin America, 1946-1980.

The bulk of the West German student protest literature in this collection comes from left-wing groups, ranging from moderate socialist to Maoist, with many nuanced variations of political affiliation in between. The topics under discussion, while largely concerned with local university issues, also refer to international politics, local or national problems and ideological disputes with rival political groups. There is also a small amount of material from religious organizations, unions and ad hoc committees formed around particular issues. Single sheet leaflets make up the bulk of the German-language material although there are also scattered issues of newspapers, pamphlets and special documents.

Under the heading "Berlin," the reader will find literature issued by the Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität, an organization formed in 1969 to combat the effects of the left-wing student groups. Based in Berlin, this committee's primary interest is the Free University of Berlin, although its publications and reprints also cover topics dealing with the universities in general and problems in contemporary German education at all levels. Its publications are mostly in German, with occasional reports in English. One Notgemeinschaft publication in English offers an overview of recent university history in Berlin: The Situation of the Berlin Universities, 1969-1973 , issued in 1973.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series and three additions: I. Underground and Radical Newspapers, 1946-1978; II. Pamphlets, Leaflets, and Broadsides, 1946-1979.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The newspapers are listed alphabetically by title.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by subject; some variations.

did.unittitle: Denver Free University. Bulletin , course lists

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The literature is arranged chronologically according to the university at which it was distributed. Thus, literature published by a student group in Munich, but distributed in Bonn, is filed under Bonn. No attempt has been made to arrange the material by party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Student leaflets and newspapers, some of which were issued on the occasion of the suicide of the German terrorists in Stammheim prison, October 1977.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assembled under this heading are pamphlets, issues of periodicals, and other materials collected during 1974 and 1975. Almost all the items are from Germany with a few from other German-speaking areas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Catalogue of a feminist press and some literature on abortion and Paragraph 218.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes posters published by OSPAAAL, International Union of Students, OCLAE; includes posters commemorating World Day of Solidarity with Cuba.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes posters published by SPD (German Workers), Nahost-Komitee Westberlin, Kommunistische Hochschulgruppe (KHG); also includes posters and periodicals, including Frauenbulletin , pertaining to women's liberation in Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The newspapers are listed alphabetically by title. The collection of other printed material (pamphlets, broadsides, leaflets, etc.) is listed alphabetically by topic or geographical area.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donated by David Dellinger, the addition mainly consists of publications for which he played a central role, including Liberation , Seven Days , Individual Action and Cooperative Living .

arrangement.p: The publications are arranged alphabetically by title.
